item.title: Kim add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Have you ever watched the jet cars race on the boulevard?...I sometimes think drivers don’t know what grass is, or flowers, because they never see them slowly...If you showed a driver a green blur, Oh yes! He'd say, that’s grass! A pink blur! That’s a rose garden! White blurs are houses. Brown blurs are cows." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kim add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Let you alone! That’s all very well, but how can I leave myself alone? We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kim add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We must all be alike. Not everyone born free and equal, as the Constitution says, but everyone made equal. Each man the image of every other; then all are happy, for there are no mountains to make them cower, to judge themselves against." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kim add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "And she did not miss his presence so much as his voice on the phone. Even being lied to constantly, though hardly like love, was sustained attention; he must care about her to fabricate so elaborately and over such a long stretch of time. His deceit was a form of tribute to the importance of their marriage." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kim add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kim add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kim add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Kim add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kim add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "I never really even tried. But if I'm not a New York actress, what am I? I'm a person who takes a subway from the outer boroughs to lower Manhattan office every morning, who spends her days answering phones and doing copying, who is too disconsolate when she gets back to her apartment at night to do anything but sit on the couch and stare vacantly at reality TV shows until she falls asleep. Oh Godm it really was true, wasn't it? I really was a secretary." -- Julie Powell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "... I began to ponder; this life we had for ourselves, Eric and I, it felt like the opposite of Potage Parmentier. It was easy enough to keep on with the soul-sucking jobs; at least it saved having to make a choice. But how much longer could I take such an easy life? Quicksand was easy. Hell, death was easy. Maybe that's why my synapses had started snapping at the sight of potatoes and leeks in the Korean deli. Maybe that was what was plucking deep down in my belly whenever I thought of Julia Child's book. Maybe I needed to make like a potato, winnow myself down, be a part of something that was not easy, just simple." -- Julie Powell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "And I realized that, for this night at least, I didn't much care if anyone was the marrying kind or not - not even me. Who could tell? We none of us knew for sure WHAT kind we were, exactly, but as long as were the kind that could sit around eating together and having a lovely time, that was enough." -- Julie Powell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "Which just goes to show, I guess, that dinner parties are like everything else - not as fragile as we think they are." -- Julie Powell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "I took a bite of lobster meat with rice. It was quite tasty. 'Arguing the morality of slaughter will send you into a tailspin of self-loathing every time.' 'Unless you're a vegan.' 'Uh-huh. But then you're a vegan and you don't count." -- Julie Powell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "Two years ago, I was a twenty-nine year old secretary. Now I am a thirty-one year old writer. I get paid very well to sit around in my pajamas and type on my ridiculously fancy iMac, unless I'd rather take a nap. Feel free to hate me -- I certainly would." -- Julie Powell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Julie Powell
item.description: "If there's a sexier sound on this planet than the person you're in love with cooing over the crepes you made for him, I don't know what it is." -- Julie Powell

item.title: Kim add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "... but to remain historically accurate, I would have had to leave out an important question that I felt needed to be addressed, which is, 'What if Jesus had known kung fu?" -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Kim add a quote by John Berger
item.description: "A man's presence suggests what he is capable of doing to you or for you. By contrast, a woman's presence . . . defines what can and cannot be done to her." -- John Berger

item.title: Kim add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I love my pizza so much, in fact, that I have come to believe in my delirium that my pizza might actually love me, in return. I am having a relationship with this pizza, almost an affair." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Kim add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "On the girl's brown legs there were many small white scars. I was thinking, Do those scars cover the whole of you, like the stars and the moons on your dress? I thought that would be pretty too, and I ask you right here please to agree with me that a scar is never ugly. That is what the scar makers want us to think. But you and I, we must make an agreement to defy them. We must see all scars as beauty. Okay? This will be our secret. Because take it from me, a scar does not form on the dying. A scar means, I survived." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Kim add a quote by Chris Cleave
item.description: "I ask you right here please to agree with me that a scar is never ugly. That is what the scar makers want us to think. But you and I, we must make an agreement to defy them. We must see all scars as beauty. Okay? This will be our secret. Because take it from me, a scar does not form on the dying. A scar means, <i>I survived</i>." -- Chris Cleave

item.title: Kim add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description:
"The Voice
There is a voice inside of you That whispers all day long, "I feel this is right for me, I know that this is wrong." No teacher, preacher, parent, friend Or wise man can decide What's right for you--just listen to The voice that speaks inside." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Kim add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "All The Woulda-Coulda-Shouldas Layin' In The Sun, Talkin' 'Bout The Things They Woulda-Coulda-Shoulda Done... But All Those Woulda-Coulda-Shouldas All Ran Away And Hid From One Little Did." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Kim add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "I feel about Photoshop the way some people feel about abortion. It is appalling and a tragic reflection on the moral decay of our society…unless I need it, in which case, everybody be cool." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Kim add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Destroying things is much easier than making them." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kim add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "Happy Hunger Games! And may the odds be ever in your favor." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kim add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're still trying to protect me. Real or not real," he whispers. "Real," I answer. "Because that's what you and I do, protect each other." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Kim add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Worrying is carrying tomorrow's load with today's strength- carrying two days at once. It is moving into tomorrow ahead of time. Worrying doesn't empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Kim add a quote by Epictetus
item.description: "Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems" -- Epictetus

item.title: Kim add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde
